definition: to drill wood to make fire
to drill/to bore/to get into/to make one's way into/to enter (a hole)/to thread one's way through/to study intensively/to dig into/to curry favor for personal gain
tree/wood/coffin/wooden/simple/numb/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86

sentences.english: I found a bent stick in the woodpile , and I can make a drill.
sentences.chinese: 我在木料堆裏找到幾捆雜草，我可以用來鑽木取火。

sentences.english: We should such as general, concentrate on, always insist.
sentences.chinese: 我們應當如鑽木取火一般，全神貫注，堅持不息。
